author: Special Correspondent
text:
Labbakudikadu near Perambalur is one of the villages with poor polling percentage in the past elections in general and during the last Assembly election in particular.

Election officials have now launched a campaign among the people of the village, especially among women folk, to persuade them to exercise their franchise without fail. Officials distributed pamphlets at Jamaaths and places of worship in the village after Friday prayers and urged them to extend their support to the campaign to achieve cent per polling.

The officials, including S. Meenakshi, District Revenue Officer, impressed upon the voters to exercise their franchise.

They administered a pledge to the voters on the occasion.
title: Campaign in low percentage area
